meanings.definition: To urge a horse to go faster by pulling on the reins.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy was geeing the horse to run swiftly.
meanings.sent2: She was geeing the horse to speed up during the race.
meanings.sent3: The horse giggled as the cowboy kept geeing it to gallop.
meanings.sent4: With a gentle geeing, the horse dashed ahead like the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sound of geeing echoed through the meadow as the horse raced ahead.

meanings.definition: To give a signal to turn right.
meanings.sent1: The driver was geeing to indicate a right turn.
meanings.sent2: Remember to use your blinker when geeing on the road.
meanings.sent3: The car started dancing after geeing to the right.
meanings.sent4: She was geeing right, but her eyes were looking left.
meanings.sent5: Geeing at the intersection, the driver smoothly turned the wheel to the right.

meanings.definition: To move or turn in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: The boat was geeing towards the shore.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was geeing left to avoid the steep cliff.
meanings.sent3: The cat was geeing around the corner to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The wind was geeing the leaves in a graceful dance.
meanings.sent5: Geeing slowly, the car navigated through the narrow alleyway.
